an4.49:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, there are these four perversions of perception, thought, and view.

an4.49:1.3.pli: Anicce, bhikkhave, niccanti saññāvipallāso cittavipallāso diṭṭhivipallāso;

an4.49:1.4.pli: dukkhe, bhikkhave, sukhanti saññāvipallāso cittavipallāso diṭṭhivipallāso;

an4.49:1.5.pli: anattani, bhikkhave, attāti saññāvipallāso cittavipallāso diṭṭhivipallāso;

an4.49:1.6.pli: asubhe, bhikkhave, subhanti saññāvipallāso cittavipallāso diṭṭhivipallāso.

an4.49:1.7.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, cattāro saññāvipallāsā cittavipallāsā diṭṭhivipallāsā.
an4.49:1.7.eng: These are the four perversions of perception, thought, and view.

an4.49:2.1.eng: There are these four corrections of perception, thought, and view.

an4.49:2.3.pli: Anicce, bhikkhave, aniccanti nasaññāvipallāso nacittavipallāso nadiṭṭhivipallāso;

an4.49:2.4.pli: dukkhe, bhikkhave, dukkhanti nasaññāvipallāso nacittavipallāso nadiṭṭhivipallāso;

an4.49:2.5.pli: anattani, bhikkhave, anattāti nasaññāvipallāso nacittavipallāso nadiṭṭhivipallāso;

an4.49:2.6.pli: asubhe, bhikkhave, asubhanti nasaññāvipallāso nacittavipallāso nadiṭṭhivipallāso.

an4.49:2.7.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, cattāro nasaññāvipallāsā nacittavipallāsā nadiṭṭhivipallāsāti.
an4.49:2.7.eng: These are the four corrections of perception, thought, and view.

an4.49:3.5.eng: sentient beings are ruined by wrong view,

an4.49:4.1.eng: Yoked by Māra’s yoke, these people

an4.49:4.2.eng: find no sanctuary from the yoke.

an4.49:5.4.eng: that leads to the stilling of suffering.

an4.49:6.1.eng: When a wise person hears them,

an4.5:1.1.eng: “These four individuals are found in the world.

an4.5:1.3.pli: Anusotagāmī puggalo, paṭisotagāmī puggalo, ṭhitatto puggalo, tiṇṇo pāraṅgato thale tiṭṭhati brāhmaṇo.
an4.5:1.3.eng: An individual who goes with the stream; an individual who goes against the stream; a steadfast individual; and a brahmin who has crossed over, gone to the far shore, and stands on solid ground.

an4.5:1.4.eng: And who is the individual who goes with the stream?

an4.5:1.5.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo kāme ca paṭisevati, pāpañca kammaṃ karoti.
an4.5:1.5.eng: It’s an individual who indulges in sensual pleasures and does bad deeds.

an4.5:1.6.eng: This is called an individual who goes with the stream.

an4.5:2.1.eng: And who is the individual who goes against the stream?

an4.5:2.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo kāme ca nappaṭisevati, pāpañca kammaṃ na karoti, sahāpi dukkhena sahāpi domanassena assumukhopi rudamāno paripuṇṇaṃ parisuddhaṃ brahmacariyaṃ carati.
an4.5:2.2.eng: It’s an individual who doesn’t indulge in sensual pleasures or do bad deeds. They live the full and pure spiritual life in pain and sadness, weeping, with tearful faces.

an4.5:2.3.eng: This is called an individual who goes against the stream.

an4.5:3.1.eng: And who is the steadfast individual?

an4.5:3.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo pañcannaṃ orambhāgiyānaṃ saṃyojanānaṃ parikkhayā opapātiko hoti, tattha parinibbāyī, anāvattidhammo tasmā lokā.
an4.5:3.2.eng: It’s an individual who, with the ending of the five lower fetters, is reborn spontaneously. They’re extinguished there, and are not liable to return from that world.

an4.5:3.3.eng: This is called a steadfast individual.

an4.5:4.1.pli: Katamo ca, bhikkhave, puggalo tiṇṇo pāraṅgato thale tiṭṭhati brāhmaṇo?
an4.5:4.1.eng: And who is a brahmin who has crossed over, gone to the far shore, and stands on solid ground?

an4.5:4.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo āsavānaṃ khayā anāsavaṃ cetovimuttiṃ paññāvimuttiṃ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati.
an4.5:4.2.eng: It’s an individual who realizes the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life. And they live having realized it with their own insight due to the ending of defilements.

an4.5:4.3.pli: Ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, puggalo tiṇṇo pāraṅgato thale tiṭṭhati brāhmaṇo.
an4.5:4.3.eng: This is called a brahmin who has crossed over, gone to the far shore, and stands on solid ground.

an4.5:4.4.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, cattāro puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasminti.
an4.5:4.4.eng: These are the four individuals found in the world.

an4.5:5.1.eng: All those people with unbridled sensuality,

an4.5:5.2.eng: not free of lust, enjoying sensual pleasures in this life:

an4.5:5.3.eng: again and again, they return to birth and old age;

an4.5:5.4.eng: those who go with the stream are sunk in craving.

an4.5:6.1.eng: So the attentive in this life, <j>with mindfulness established,

an4.5:6.2.eng: don’t take part in sensual pleasures and bad deeds.

an4.5:6.3.eng: In pain they’d give up sensual pleasures:

an4.5:6.4.eng: they call that individual ‘one who goes against the stream’.

an4.5:7.1.eng: Someone who’s given up five corruptions,

an4.5:7.2.eng: a perfect trainee, not liable to decline,

an4.5:7.3.eng: who’s mastered their mind, <j>with faculties immersed in samādhi,

an4.5:8.1.eng: The sage who has comprehended all things, <j>high and low,

an4.5:8.2.eng: cleared them and ended them, so they are no more;

an4.5:8.3.eng: they’ve completed the spiritual journey, <j>and gone to the end of the world,

an4.5:8.4.eng: they’re called ‘one who has gone beyond’.”

an4.50:1.1.pli: “Cattārome, bhikkhave, candimasūriyānaṃ upakkilesā, yehi upakkilesehi upakkiliṭṭhā candimasūriyā na tapanti na bhāsanti na virocanti.
an4.50:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, these four corruptions obscure the sun and moon, so they don’t shine and glow and radiate.

an4.50:1.3.pli: Abbhā, bhikkhave, candimasūriyānaṃ upakkilesā, yena upakkilesena upakkiliṭṭhā candimasūriyā na tapanti na bhāsanti na virocanti.

an4.50:2.1.pli: Mahikā, bhikkhave, candimasūriyānaṃ upakkilesā, yena upakkilesena upakkiliṭṭhā candimasūriyā na tapanti na bhāsanti na virocanti.

an4.50:3.1.pli: Dhūmo rajo, bhikkhave, candimasūriyānaṃ upakkileso, yena upakkilesena upakkiliṭṭhā candimasūriyā na tapanti na bhāsanti na virocanti.

an4.50:4.1.pli: Rāhu, bhikkhave, asurindo candimasūriyānaṃ upakkileso, yena upakkilesena upakkiliṭṭhā candimasūriyā na tapanti na bhāsanti na virocanti.
an4.50:4.1.eng: An eclipse of Rāhu, lord of titans …

an4.50:4.2.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, cattāro candimasūriyānaṃ upakkilesā, yehi upakkilesehi upakkiliṭṭhā candimasūriyā na tapanti na bhāsanti na virocanti.
an4.50:4.2.eng: These are four corruptions that obscure the sun and moon, so they don’t shine and glow and radiate.

an4.50:5.1.pli: Evamevaṃ kho, bhikkhave, cattārome samaṇabrāhmaṇānaṃ upakkilesā, yehi upakkilesehi upakkiliṭṭhā eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā na tapanti na bhāsanti na virocanti.
an4.50:5.1.eng: In the same way, these four things corrupt ascetics and brahmins, so they don’t shine and glow and radiate.

an4.50:5.3.pli: Santi, bhikkhave, eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā suraṃ pivanti merayaṃ, surāmerayapānā appaṭiviratā.
an4.50:5.3.eng: There are some ascetics and brahmins who drink beer and wine, not refraining from drinking beer and wine.

an4.50:5.4.pli: Ayaṃ, bhikkhave, paṭhamo samaṇabrāhmaṇānaṃ upakkileso, yena upakkilesena upakkiliṭṭhā eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā na tapanti na bhāsanti na virocanti.
an4.50:5.4.eng: This is the first thing that corrupts ascetics and brahmins …

an4.50:6.1.pli: Santi, bhikkhave, eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevanti, methunasmā dhammā appaṭiviratā.
an4.50:6.1.eng: There are some ascetics and brahmins who have sex, not refraining from sex.

an4.50:6.2.pli: Ayaṃ, bhikkhave, dutiyo samaṇabrāhmaṇānaṃ upakkileso, yena upakkilesena upakkiliṭṭhā eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā na tapanti na bhāsanti na virocanti.
an4.50:6.2.eng: This is the second thing that corrupts ascetics and brahmins …

an4.50:7.1.pli: Santi, bhikkhave, eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā jātarūparajataṃ sādiyanti, jātarūparajatapaṭiggahaṇā appaṭiviratā.
an4.50:7.1.eng: There are some ascetics and brahmins who accept gold and currency, not refraining from receiving gold and currency.

an4.50:7.2.pli: Ayaṃ, bhikkhave, tatiyo samaṇabrāhmaṇānaṃ upakkileso, yena upakkilesena upakkiliṭṭhā eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā na tapanti na bhāsanti na virocanti.
an4.50:7.2.eng: This is the third thing that corrupts ascetics and brahmins …

an4.50:8.1.pli: Santi, bhikkhave, eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā micchājīvena jīvanti, micchājīvā appaṭiviratā.
an4.50:8.1.eng: There are some ascetics and brahmins who make a living the wrong way, not refraining from wrong livelihood.

an4.50:8.2.pli: Ayaṃ, bhikkhave, catuttho samaṇabrāhmaṇānaṃ upakkileso, yena upakkilesena upakkiliṭṭhā eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā na tapanti na bhāsanti na virocanti.
an4.50:8.2.eng: This is the fourth thing that corrupts ascetics and brahmins …

an4.50:8.3.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, cattāro samaṇabrāhmaṇānaṃ upakkilesā, yehi upakkilesehi upakkiliṭṭhā eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā na tapanti na bhāsanti na virocantīti.
an4.50:8.3.eng: These are four things that corrupt ascetics and brahmins, so they don’t shine and glow and radiate.

an4.50:9.2.eng: are plagued by greed and hate;

an4.50:10.6.eng: make a living the wrong way.

an4.50:11.2.eng: by the Buddha, Kinsman of the Sun.

an4.50:12.2.eng: bondservants of craving, full of attachments,

an4.50:12.3.eng: swell the horrors of the charnel ground,

an4.51:1.2.pli: “Cattārome, bhikkhave, puññābhisandā kusalābhisandā sukhassāhārā sovaggikā sukhavipākā saggasaṃvattanikā iṭṭhāya kantāya manāpāya hitāya sukhāya saṃvattanti.
an4.51:1.2.eng: “Mendicants, there are these four kinds of overflowing merit, overflowing goodness. They nurture happiness and are conducive to heaven, ripening in happiness and leading to heaven. They lead to what is likable, desirable, agreeable, to welfare and happiness.

an4.51:1.4.pli: Yassa, bhikkhave, bhikkhu cīvaraṃ paribhuñjamāno appamāṇaṃ cetosamādhiṃ upasampajja viharati, appamāṇo tassa puññābhisando kusalābhisando sukhassāhāro sovaggiko sukhavipāko saggasaṃvattaniko iṭṭhāya kantāya manāpāya hitāya sukhāya saṃvattati.
an4.51:1.4.eng: When a mendicant enters and remains in a limitless immersion of heart while using a robe, the overflowing of merit for the donor is limitless …

an4.51:2.1.pli: Yassa, bhikkhave, bhikkhu piṇḍapātaṃ paribhuñjamāno appamāṇaṃ cetosamādhiṃ upasampajja viharati, appamāṇo tassa puññābhisando kusalābhisando sukhassāhāro sovaggiko sukhavipāko saggasaṃvattaniko iṭṭhāya kantāya manāpāya hitāya sukhāya saṃvattati.
an4.51:2.1.eng: When a mendicant enters and remains in a limitless immersion of heart while eating almsfood, the overflowing of merit for the donor is limitless …

an4.51:3.1.pli: Yassa, bhikkhave, bhikkhu senāsanaṃ paribhuñjamāno appamāṇaṃ cetosamādhiṃ upasampajja viharati, appamāṇo tassa puññābhisando kusalābhisando sukhassāhāro sovaggiko sukhavipāko saggasaṃvattaniko iṭṭhāya kantāya manāpāya hitāya sukhāya saṃvattati.
an4.51:3.1.eng: When a mendicant enters and remains in a limitless immersion of heart while using lodgings, the overflowing of merit for the donor is limitless …

an4.51:4.1.pli: Yassa, bhikkhave, bhikkhu gilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhāraṃ paribhuñjamāno appamāṇaṃ cetosamādhiṃ upasampajja viharati, appamāṇo tassa puññābhisando kusalābhisando sukhassāhāro sovaggiko sukhavipāko saggasaṃvattaniko iṭṭhāya kantāya manāpāya hitāya sukhāya saṃvattati.
an4.51:4.1.eng: When a mendicant enters and remains in a limitless immersion of heart while using medicines and supplies for the sick, the overflowing of merit for the donor is limitless …

an4.51:4.2.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, cattāro puññābhisandā kusalābhisandā sukhassāhārā sovaggikā sukhavipākā saggasaṃvattanikā iṭṭhāya kantāya manāpāya hitāya sukhāya saṃvattanti.
an4.51:4.2.eng: These are the four kinds of overflowing merit, overflowing goodness. They nurture happiness and are conducive to heaven, ripening in happiness and leading to heaven. They lead to what is likable, desirable, agreeable, to welfare and happiness.

an4.51:5.1.pli: Imehi ca pana, bhikkhave, catūhi puññābhisandehi kusalābhisandehi samannāgatassa ariyasāvakassa na sukaraṃ puññassa pamāṇaṃ gahetuṃ: ‘ettako puññābhisando kusalābhisando sukhassāhāro sovaggiko sukhavipāko saggasaṃvattaniko iṭṭhāya kantāya manāpāya hitāya sukhāya saṃvattatī’ti. Atha kho asaṅkhyeyyo appameyyo mahāpuññakkhandhotveva saṅkhyaṃ gacchati.
an4.51:5.1.eng: When a noble disciple has these four kinds of overflowing merit and goodness, it’s not easy to grasp how much merit they have by saying that this is the extent of their overflowing merit … that leads to happiness. It’s simply reckoned as an incalculable, immeasurable, great mass of merit.

an4.51:6.1.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, mahāsamudde na sukaraṃ udakassa pamāṇaṃ gahetuṃ: ‘ettakāni udakāḷhakānīti vā, ettakāni udakāḷhakasatānīti vā, ettakāni udakāḷhakasahassānīti vā, ettakāni udakāḷhakasatasahassānīti vā’, atha kho asaṅkhyeyyo appameyyo mahāudakakkhandhotveva saṅkhyaṃ gacchati;
an4.51:6.1.eng: It’s like trying to grasp how much water is in the ocean. It’s not easy to say how many gallons, how many hundreds, thousands, hundreds of thousands of gallons there are. It’s simply reckoned as an incalculable, immeasurable, great mass of water.

an4.51:6.2.pli: evamevaṃ kho, bhikkhave, imehi catūhi puññābhisandehi kusalābhisandehi samannāgatassa ariyasāvakassa na sukaraṃ puññassa pamāṇaṃ gahetuṃ: ‘ettako puññābhisando kusalābhisando sukhassāhāro sovaggiko sukhavipāko saggasaṃvattaniko iṭṭhāya kantāya manāpāya hitāya sukhāya saṃvattatī’ti. Atha kho asaṅkhyeyyo appameyyo mahāpuññakkhandhotveva saṅkhyaṃ gacchatīti.
an4.51:6.2.eng: In the same way, when a noble disciple has these four kinds of overflowing merit it’s simply reckoned as an incalculable, immeasurable, great mass of merit.

an4.51:7.1.eng: Hosts of people use the rivers,

an4.51:7.2.eng: and though the rivers are many,

an4.51:7.3.eng: all reach the great deep, the boundless ocean,

an4.51:7.4.eng: the cruel sea that’s home to precious gems.

an4.51:8.1.eng: In the same way, when a person gives <j>food, drink, and clothes;

an4.51:8.2.eng: and they’re a giver of beds, seats, and mats—

an4.51:8.3.eng: the streams of merit reach that astute person,

an4.51:8.4.eng: as the rivers bring their waters to the sea.”

an4.52:1.1.pli: “Cattārome, bhikkhave, puññābhisandā kusalābhisandā sukhassāhārā sovaggikā sukhavipākā saggasaṃvattanikā iṭṭhāya kantāya manāpāya hitāya sukhāya saṃvattanti.
an4.52:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, there are these four kinds of overflowing merit, overflowing goodness. They nurture happiness and are conducive to heaven, ripening in happiness and leading to heaven. They lead to what is likable, desirable, agreeable, to welfare and happiness.

an4.52:1.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ariyasāvako buddhe aveccappasādena samannāgato hoti:
an4.52:1.3.eng: It’s when a noble disciple has experiential confidence in the Buddha:

an4.52:1.4.pli: ‘itipi so bhagavā arahaṃ sammāsambuddho vijjācaraṇasampanno sugato lokavidū anuttaro purisadammasārathi satthā devamanussānaṃ buddho bhagavā’ti.
an4.52:1.4.eng: ‘That Blessed One is perfected, a fully awakened Buddha, accomplished in knowledge and conduct, holy, knower of the world, supreme guide for those fit for training, teacher of gods and humans, awakened, blessed.’

an4.52:1.5.pli: Ayaṃ, bhikkhave, paṭhamo puññābhisando kusalābhisando sukhassāhāro sovaggiko sukhavipāko saggasaṃvattaniko iṭṭhāya kantāya manāpāya hitāya sukhāya saṃvattati.
an4.52:1.5.eng: This is the first kind of overflowing merit …

an4.52:2.1.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, ariyasāvako dhamme aveccappasādena samannāgato hoti:
an4.52:2.1.eng: Furthermore, a noble disciple has experiential confidence in the teaching:

an4.52:2.2.pli: ‘svākkhāto bhagavatā dhammo sandiṭṭhiko akāliko ehipassiko opaneyyiko paccattaṃ veditabbo viññūhī’ti.
an4.52:2.2.eng: ‘The teaching is well explained by the Buddha—apparent in the present life, immediately effective, inviting inspection, relevant, so that sensible people can know it for themselves.’

an4.52:2.3.pli: Ayaṃ, bhikkhave, dutiyo puññābhisando kusalābhisando sukhassāhāro sovaggiko sukhavipāko saggasaṃvattaniko iṭṭhāya kantāya manāpāya hitāya sukhāya saṃvattati.
an4.52:2.3.eng: This is the second kind of overflowing merit …

an4.52:3.1.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, ariyasāvako saṅghe aveccappasādena samannāgato hoti:
an4.52:3.1.eng: Furthermore, a noble disciple has experiential confidence in the Saṅgha:

an4.52:3.2.pli: ‘suppaṭipanno bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho, ujuppaṭipanno bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho, ñāyappaṭipanno bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho, sāmīcippaṭipanno bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho, yadidaṃ cattāri purisayugāni aṭṭha purisapuggalā, esa bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho āhuneyyo pāhuneyyo dakkhiṇeyyo añjalikaraṇīyo anuttaraṃ puññakkhettaṃ lokassā’ti.
an4.52:3.2.eng: ‘The Saṅgha of the Buddha’s disciples is practicing the way that’s good, direct, systematic, and proper. It consists of the four pairs, the eight individual persons. This is the Saṅgha of the Buddha’s disciples that is worthy of offerings dedicated to the gods, worthy of hospitality, worthy of a religious donation, worthy of greeting with joined palms, and is the supreme field of merit for the world.’

an4.52:3.3.pli: Ayaṃ, bhikkhave, tatiyo puññābhisando kusalābhisando sukhassāhāro sovaggiko sukhavipāko saggasaṃvattaniko iṭṭhāya kantāya manāpāya hitāya sukhāya saṃvattati.
an4.52:3.3.eng: This is the third kind of overflowing merit …

an4.52:4.1.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, ariyasāvako ariyakantehi sīlehi samannāgato hoti akhaṇḍehi acchiddehi asabalehi akammāsehi bhujissehi viññuppasatthehi aparāmaṭṭhehi samādhisaṃvattanikehi.
an4.52:4.1.eng: Furthermore, a noble disciple’s ethical conduct is loved by the noble ones, unbroken, impeccable, spotless, and unmarred, liberating, praised by sensible people, not mistaken, and leading to immersion.

an4.52:4.2.pli: Ayaṃ, bhikkhave, catuttho puññābhisando kusalābhisando sukhassāhāro sovaggiko sukhavipāko saggasaṃvattaniko iṭṭhāya kantāya manāpāya hitāya sukhāya saṃvattati.
an4.52:4.2.eng: This is the fourth kind of overflowing merit …

an4.52:4.3.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, cattāro puññābhisandā kusalābhisandā sukhassāhārā sovaggikā sukhavipākā saggasaṃvattanikā iṭṭhāya kantāya manāpāya hitāya sukhāya saṃvattantīti.
an4.52:4.3.eng: These are the four kinds of overflowing merit, overflowing goodness. They nurture happiness and are conducive to heaven, ripening in happiness and leading to heaven. They lead to what is likable, desirable, agreeable, to welfare and happiness.

an4.52:5.1.eng: Whoever has faith in the Realized One,

an4.52:5.4.eng: praised and loved by the noble ones;

an4.52:6.1.eng: who has confidence in the Saṅgha,

an4.52:6.4.eng: their life is not in vain.

an4.52:7.1.eng: So let the wise devote themselves

an4.52:7.3.eng: confidence, and insight into the teaching,

an4.52:7.4.eng: remembering the instructions of the Buddhas.”

an4.53:1.1.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā antarā ca madhuraṃ antarā ca verañjaṃ addhānamaggappaṭipanno hoti.
an4.53:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was traveling along the road between Madhurā and Verañjā,

an4.53:1.2.pli: Sambahulāpi kho gahapatī ca gahapatāniyo ca antarā ca madhuraṃ antarā ca verañjaṃ addhānamaggappaṭipannā honti.
an4.53:1.2.eng: as were several householders, both women and men.

an4.53:1.3.pli: Atha kho bhagavā maggā okkamma aññatarasmiṃ rukkhamūle (…) nisīdi.
an4.53:1.3.eng: The Buddha left the road and sat at the root of a tree,

an4.53:1.4.pli: Addasaṃsu kho gahapatī ca gahapatāniyo ca bhagavantaṃ aññatarasmiṃ rukkhamūle nisinnaṃ.

an4.53:1.5.pli: Disvā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṃsu; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdiṃsu. Ekamantaṃ nisinne kho te gahapatī ca gahapatāniyo ca bhagavā etadavoca:
an4.53:1.5.eng: They went up to the Buddha, bowed, and sat down to one side. The Buddha said to them:

an4.53:2.1.eng: “Householders, there are four ways of living together.

an4.53:2.3.eng: A male zombie living with a female zombie;

an4.53:2.4.eng: a male zombie living with a goddess;

an4.53:2.5.eng: a god living with a female zombie;

an4.53:2.6.eng: a god living with a goddess.

an4.53:3.1.pli: Kathañca, gahapatayo, chavo chavāya saddhiṃ saṃvasati?
an4.53:3.1.eng: And how does a male zombie live with a female zombie?

an4.53:3.2.pli: Idha, gahapatayo, sāmiko hoti pāṇātipātī adinnādāyī kāmesumicchācārī musāvādī surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhāyī dussīlo pāpadhammo maccheramalapariyuṭṭhitena cetasā agāraṃ ajjhāvasati akkosakaparibhāsako samaṇabrāhmaṇānaṃ;
an4.53:3.2.eng: It’s when the husband kills living creatures, steals, commits sexual misconduct, lies, and consumes beer, wine, and liquor intoxicants. He’s unethical, of bad character, living at home with his heart full of the stain of stinginess, abusing and insulting ascetics and brahmins.

an4.53:3.3.pli: bhariyāpissa hoti pāṇātipātinī adinnādāyinī kāmesumicchācārinī musāvādinī surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhāyinī dussīlā pāpadhammā maccheramalapariyuṭṭhitena cetasā agāraṃ ajjhāvasati akkosikaparibhāsikā samaṇabrāhmaṇānaṃ.
an4.53:3.3.eng: And the wife is also … unethical, of bad character …

an4.53:3.4.pli: Evaṃ kho, gahapatayo, chavo chavāya saddhiṃ saṃvasati.
an4.53:3.4.eng: That’s how a male zombie lives with a female zombie.

an4.53:4.1.pli: Kathañca, gahapatayo, chavo deviyā saddhiṃ saṃvasati?
an4.53:4.1.eng: And how does a male zombie live with a goddess?

an4.53:4.2.pli: Idha, gahapatayo, sāmiko hoti pāṇātipātī adinnādāyī kāmesumicchācārī musāvādī surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhāyī dussīlo pāpadhammo maccheramalapariyuṭṭhitena cetasā agāraṃ ajjhāvasati akkosakaparibhāsako samaṇabrāhmaṇānaṃ;
an4.53:4.2.eng: It’s when the husband … is unethical, of bad character …

an4.53:4.3.pli: bhariyā khvassa hoti pāṇātipātā paṭiviratā adinnādānā paṭiviratā kāmesumicchācārā paṭiviratā musāvādā paṭiviratā surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhānā paṭiviratā sīlavatī kalyāṇadhammā vigatamalamaccherena cetasā agāraṃ ajjhāvasati anakkosikaparibhāsikā samaṇabrāhmaṇānaṃ.
an4.53:4.3.eng: But the wife doesn’t kill living creatures, steal, commit sexual misconduct, lie, or consume beer, wine, and liquor intoxicants. She’s ethical, of good character, living at home with her heart rid of the stain of stinginess, not abusing and insulting ascetics and brahmins.

an4.53:4.4.pli: Evaṃ kho, gahapatayo, chavo deviyā saddhiṃ saṃvasati.
an4.53:4.4.eng: That’s how a male zombie lives with a goddess.

an4.53:5.1.pli: Kathañca, gahapatayo, devo chavāya saddhiṃ saṃvasati?
an4.53:5.1.eng: And how does a god live with a female zombie?

an4.53:5.2.pli: Idha, gahapatayo, sāmiko hoti pāṇātipātā paṭivirato adinnādānā paṭivirato kāmesumicchācārā paṭivirato musāvādā paṭivirato surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhānā paṭivirato sīlavā kalyāṇadhammo vigatamalamaccherena cetasā agāraṃ ajjhāvasati anakkosakaparibhāsako samaṇabrāhmaṇānaṃ;
an4.53:5.2.eng: It’s when the husband … is ethical, of good character …

an4.53:5.3.pli: bhariyā khvassa hoti pāṇātipātinī …pe… surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhāyinī dussīlā pāpadhammā maccheramalapariyuṭṭhitena cetasā agāraṃ ajjhāvasati akkosikaparibhāsikā samaṇabrāhmaṇānaṃ.
an4.53:5.3.eng: But the wife … is unethical, of bad character …

an4.53:5.4.pli: Evaṃ kho, gahapatayo, devo chavāya saddhiṃ saṃvasati.
an4.53:5.4.eng: That’s how a god lives with a female zombie.

an4.53:6.1.pli: Kathañca, gahapatayo, devo deviyā saddhiṃ saṃvasati?
an4.53:6.1.eng: And how does a god live with a goddess?

an4.53:6.2.pli: Idha, gahapatayo, sāmiko hoti pāṇātipātā paṭivirato …pe… sīlavā kalyāṇadhammo vigatamalamaccherena cetasā agāraṃ ajjhāvasati anakkosakaparibhāsako samaṇabrāhmaṇānaṃ;
an4.53:6.2.eng: It’s when the husband … is ethical, of good character …

an4.53:6.3.pli: bhariyāpissa hoti pāṇātipātā paṭiviratā …pe… surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhānā paṭiviratā sīlavatī kalyāṇadhammā vigatamalamaccherena cetasā agāraṃ ajjhāvasati anakkosikaparibhāsikā samaṇabrāhmaṇānaṃ.
an4.53:6.3.eng: And the wife is also … ethical, of good character …

an4.53:6.4.pli: Evaṃ kho, gahapatayo, devo deviyā saddhiṃ saṃvasati.
an4.53:6.4.eng: That’s how a god lives with a goddess.

an4.53:6.5.eng: These are the four ways of living together.

an4.53:8.6.eng: with a zombie for a husband.

an4.53:9.6.eng: with a god for a husband.

an4.53:10.1.eng: When both are faithful and bountiful,

an4.53:10.4.eng: say nice things to each other.

an4.53:11.4.eng: when both are equal in ethics.

an4.53:12.2.eng: both equal in precepts and observances,

an4.53:12.3.eng: they delight in the heavenly realm,

an4.53:12.4.eng: enjoying all the pleasures they desire.”
